== Authentication

=== [[request-access-token]] Requesting access token

Here we'll describe how to obtain a bearer token from our authentication server using your `<clientId>_app`-client.
For this you will need a registered user on the Arkane network
. This needs to be a registered user within Arkane and not a user that is only user social logins (in case you already used a social login, simply register and the accounts will be linked)

image::img/appclientauthentication.png[<clientId>_app flow]

.URL
https://login.arkane.network/auth/realms/Arkane/protocol/openid-connect/token

.Example Curl Request
[source,bash]
----
$ curl https://login.arkane.network/auth/realms/Arkane/protocol/openid-connect/token -i -X POST \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    -d 'grant_type=client_credentials&client_id=Arketype_app&client_secret=02053a9d-8293-43c4-a201-f8669f1329af'
----

IMPORTANT: Do not forget to set the `Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded` header (and to make the request body application/x-www-form-urlencoded), otherwise the request will fail

.Request Fields
|===
| Path | Type | Description | Constraints
| grant_type | String | The OpenId Connect grant type you want to use | Mandatory, always `client_credentials`
| client_id | String | The `clientId` you want to request a token for | Mandatory, e.g. `Arketype_app`
| client_secret | String | The shared secret you've received when you requested your `<clientId>`-client | Mandatory
| username | String | The username you used when signing up (email address)  | Mandatory
| password | String | The password that was used when signing up | Mandatory
|===

.Reponse Fields
|===
| Path | Type | Description
| access_token | String | The JWT token to use as bearer token when doing the api calls
| expires_in | number | The amount of seconds the access_token is valid
| refresh_expires_in | number | The amount of seconds the refresh_token is valid
| refresh_token | String | The JWT token which can be used to refresh the current token
| token_type | String | bearer | The type of the access_token
|===

.Response Body
[source,json]
----
{
    "access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJmQi1UenBOb0hBVGhwT2J4aW9qTDBrdm83MldmRzRXRXh1eFpiaXlGQUhzIn0..iBsj3jlmg0Ns3J4qB9Ii3a3d0Bn4472fhPNrfsYm5gPFnt2l7TOvE4JdUolv0UJe9IMrTyQYv-_EPDU7_lv8edQmyEm2YxUwUzDT747sQmkByPrxguECMrG5eOw69Iw2mtfOHVipGhivXGDr3J-Bngwj1dilYLEz8ncuAG8XrGIlqjZ3C0h_XVKUsfQcg2_EIbqcNPTwoovma1qbpS5kwWmBI4xdNHUVyV_m9HFabc2M8RQvvz5xTX4xhICJzvKRQCKOPFd3XqBNW3kG0iCJkHfOX5GNPn9Efcqfo1xFAEEjTKUOFbs8g4FQlm_YcGPumj3jk0dbN8ROlH8vuuvPxw",
    "expires_in": 1800,
    "refresh_expires_in": 432000,
    "refresh_token": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJmQi1UenBOb0hBVGhwT2J4aW9qTDBrdm83MldmRzRXRXh1eFpiaXlGQUhzIn0..FayuAxy2x1lOw4nQqvn2gZs6Vhqtt7pai6H6LNvFmAxqab3qdnMxQRRFVgrvqfgwaI5bsLrs6CdPU1w2DJmNjh3ubcw-arpM25FVWHufldcTpEA0Xvpo1zssXQrt46kMQ0SMDiRY5e3dhpcd1Uoib9NzZTM5sbwHihqxGyH9HlcO7kGGhdoFW7jXQgGSoBhKsQN1BGvam9p9v-vZSBBQD6YPNttf7cZG77PjK8BAuZczhl7cX8Csmyht6clRTeFKF06NNUwaEcvz7ZXBf2QNJVfAyG26OwUu9ER5bADofGn2P7PnAxDsq_kRXMzOULISLLPi2hdNHOzh2XNvM6znOQ",
    "token_type": "bearer"
}
----

=== Refresh access token

Since the access token has a short lifespan, it is necessary to get a new access token before.
In the case the login flow does not require input, you can request a new access token as above.
It is also possible to regenerate a new access token using the refresh token:

.URL
https://login.arkane.network/auth/realms/Arkane/protocol/openid-connect/token

.Example Curl Request
[source,bash]
----
$ curl https://login.arkane.network/auth/realms/Arkane/protocol/openid-connect/token -i -X POST \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    -d 'grant_type=refresh_token&client_id=Arketype_app&client_secret=02053a9d-8293-43c4-a201-f8669f1329af&refresh_token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJlOTVlMDc2NC1lZmVkLTQyMmEtYmU0Mi1iZTcwYmY1Nzg2NDYifQ..Ik-KF71yMqrugzf7zUvj-DylkzZv6l-lltfwA_XxN6I'
----

IMPORTANT: Do not forget to set the `Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded` header (and to make the request body application/x-www-form-urlencoded), otherwise the request will fail

.Request Fields
|===
| Path | Type | Description | Constraints
| grant_type | String | The OpenId Connect grant type you want to use | Mandatory, always `client_credentials`
| client_id | String | The `clientId` you want to request a token for | Mandatory, e.g. `Arketype_app`
| client_secret | String | The shared secret you've received when you requested your `<clientId>`-client | Mandatory
| username | String | The username you used when signing up (email address)  | Mandatory
| password | String | The password that was used when signing up (see <<request-access-token>>) | Mandatory
|===

.Reponse Fields
|===
| Path | Type | Description
| access_token | String | The JWT token to use as bearer token when doing the api calls
| expires_in | number | The amount of seconds the access_token is valid
| refresh_expires_in | number | The amount of seconds the refresh_token is valid
| refresh_token | String | The JWT token which can be used to refresh the current token
| token_type | String | bearer | The type of the access_token
|===

.Response Body
[source,json]
----
{
    "access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NdfqesInR5cCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJmQi1UenBOb0hBVGhwT2J4aW9qTDBrdm83MldmRzRXRXh1eFpiaXlGQUhzIn0..OKzqoK9UpKGrKk9Mdl1wkDAX9u7RibIhVWtFQSQwL4VvTxcsFG9zjag3ZJlhA7jVe7KSkhRX3OFhfMXgOe5pGX-YYXwUbp-UkKEA2VsQ8VWQrUg_zFswxXlZP7uKDmCla9Hhu57hU2W0sMtiZnyBGWkFDvRNOfD95E4AtZpvXsH6NaKwaPZHuqt2jiwItxXWFNb1XPvxJEdEH6A1LLrHYiDqVbsOwrA_Wg9i6GxXEom_1vEfNruhcsmmkHolsCMjhApX-lh3YXFHm2rSMJgfW1lyfHZxSiY1QPxRQCChUhIogPbLbtI6bTysKCt4uPMIIbRPZ9LgYVQ3gNMIe9br3g",
    "expires_in": 1800,
    "refresh_expires_in": 432000,
    "refresh_token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsfqefCIgOiAiSldUIiwia2lkIiA6ICJlOTVlMDc2NC1lZmVkLTQyMmEtYmU0Mi1iZTcwYmY1Nzg2NDYifQ..56vlEy1o1uMEEGA4JTXhg0yqfXLmV8eWyjMLcR2VQvU",
    "token_type": "bearer",
    "not-before-policy": 1572970662,
    "session_state": "66fa95a1-ba2c-43ba-b252-b8326be1216e3",
    "scope": "view:wallets use:all-wallets view:clients-statistics view:profile save:transaction email profile"
}
----

=== Using access token

When calling the API, the access token must be provided inside the HTTP authentication header:

[source,bash]
----
curl -H "Authorization: Beaerer ACCESS-TOKEN" https://business.arkane.network
----

=== [[metadata]] Metadata

The metadata is loosely based on a combination of the https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-721.md[ERC721] and https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1155.md[ERC1155] metadata standards and it's goal is to be compatible with most metadata standards.

==== Get metadata

Returns the metadata for a specific token type

operation::get-token-metadata[snippets='curl-request,path-parameters,http-response,response-fields']

==== Update metadata

Updates the metadata for a specific token type

operation::update-token-metadata[snippets='curl-request,path-parameters,request-body,http-response']
